paragraphs.text: Will Congress give Alibaba a green light to crush America's small businesses?
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: I actually know something about China
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I lived there and helped U.S  companies negotiate trade deals and contracts
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it was not a glamorous job
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I spent my last night in China in June 1989 in a baggage X-ray machine at the Beijing Airport as tanks rolled into Tiananmen Square
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Only one bus full of Japanese tourists made it to the airport the next morning
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I sneaked out of my hiding place and slipped into their lines ... unnoticed
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Not long after that I watched on television as a brave young man tried to block a phalanx of tanks heading into the square
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The world learned something very important that day: Get in the way of the Chinese Communist Party and you'll be crushed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Chinese economy is now estimated by some to be larger than our own
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Radio talk show host Mark Levin even predicted on his show that the U.S  would lose its technological advantage to the Chinese within 10 years
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: How will this happen?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Will China send its tanks to New York City and invade the banks, or to Silicon Valley to steal away our intellectual property?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: No need to
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: we're actually handing them our wealth
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: oddly enough, many seem pretty content about it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I'm not a protectionist
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I'm no sucker, either
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Preserving free markets takes work
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: what's strange is that today we're actively distorting markets to the detriment of our domestic industries
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: History is replete with governments working against Adam Smith's invisible hand, but always with the intention of protecting their own
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We're doing the opposite
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There has been a debate brewing for decades within conservative circles over whether Congress should give deference to the 10th Amendment and allow States to control their own sales tax systems, or whether they should be prevented from collecting sales taxes on goods sold online under the guise of lower taxes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In my mind there's nothing conservative or free market about protecting businesses from competition
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Since
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: online shopping became the rage a decade and a half ago
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Americans have enjoyed buying items -- from home necessities to Christmas presents -- without paying sales tax
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I made up my mind on this issue in the 1990s after I kept hearing some politicians assert that Internet companies must be nurtured and protected while in their infancy
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: There' s nothing conservative or free market about protecting businesses from competition
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Amazon and eBay look extremely well nurtured after decades of special tax treatment
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: while
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: mom-and-pop Main Street retailers have been forced to charge sales tax
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Well, a game changer named Alibaba, a billion-dollar Chinese e-commerce marketplace that's bigger than Amazon and eBay,combined, is now entering the American market
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Fresh off the largest IPO in Wall Street history and flush with cash, within two years Alibaba and its hundreds of thousands of Chinese retailers will be selling the same goods and products to Americans the same way Amazon does
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's bad enough that local stores have had to compete on a tilted playing field against American e-tailers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: extending this uncompetitive advantage to subsidized overseas giants like Alibaba could spell the end for countless American business owners
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Congress has the power to change this
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the U.S  Senate has already overwhelmingly voted 69-27 to pass the Marketplace Fairness Act to close the online sales tax loophole
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Even Amazon, which fought closing the sales tax loophole for years, now supports the Marketplace Fairness Act
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Conservatives in the Senate were divided on this vote
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: my hope is state legislatures will follow conservative Gov  Scott Walker's lead in Wisconsin and pass laws offsetting any revenue increases with corresponding income tax cuts
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Conservatives should be of one mind to keep taxes as low as possible
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we can also work to ensure that markets remain free and competitive
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is now up to the House of Representatives to decide if they're going to stand up for small businesses or cut them off at the knees with a wet kiss for Alibaba
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you're kissing Alibaba
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: you're essentially in bed with the Chinese government and its Communist Party
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which cares even less about the American economy than it cared for the heroic student who stood in front of the tanks in Tiananmen Square
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As a recent Wall Street Journal editorial put it
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "[N]o one in China earns or keeps such wealth or celebrity without support from the Communist Party
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: [Alibaba's Chairman Jack] Ma recently accompanied President Xi Jinping on a state visit to South Korea
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a strong IPO debut could yield billion-dollar payouts for Beijing's sovereign wealth fund and several private investment firms tied to children and grandchildren of Party leaders."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Why on earth would conservatives and Republicans want to undercut the local small businesses they claim to represent in favor of an online retailing Goliath backed by the Chinese government?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This would be the height of lunacy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A standard talking point for GOP leaders, office holders and candidates has been to strongly advocate for small business
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: House Republicans don't close this loophole
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: , the damage done to the GOP's relationship with one of its core constituencies could be irreparable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: How many GOP incumbents want to see this ad run against them in the next election?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It would be both good politics and good policy to close the loophole so everyone - including Alibaba - has to compete by the same rules
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That is, after all, what a free market is all about
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Dan Schneider is executive director of the American Conservative Union
paragraphs.label: anecdote
